docs.lead_paragraph: This weekend, Mercy Independence Hospital in Kansas will join dozens of rural hospitals that have closed in the last five years, because of declining reimbursements, regulatory burdens and shrinking populations.

headline.main: Closing a Hospital, and Fearing for the Future
headline.print_headline: Closing a Hospital, and Fearing for the Future

docs.abstract: Residents of Independence, Kan, worry about implications of closing of Mercy Hospital for both their personal health and future of community; hospital will become 58th rural hospital to close in United States since 2010; rural hospital closures have increased in past several years due to number of factors, including decline in Medicare reimbursements.
docs.snippet: This weekend, Mercy Independence Hospital in Kansas will join dozens of rural hospitals that have closed in the last five years, because of declining reimbursements, regulatory burdens and shrinking populations.

byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Independence, and Abby Goodnough from Washington.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and ABBY GOODNOUGH

docs.lead_paragraph: Jeb Bush boasts he won’t court voters with handouts, but the government gives generously to all tax brackets.

headline.main: We All Get ‘Free Stuff’ From the Government

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by economist Bryce Covert contends Republican focus on welfare programs constituting 'free stuff' that drains American economy obscures far greater cost imposed by tax breaks; notes government spends under $100 billion combined on food stamps and assistance to needy families per year, while $900 billion is lost through tax code; argues tax breaks are simply less visible form of handout.
docs.snippet: Jeb Bush boasts he won’t court voters with handouts, but the government gives generously to all tax brackets.

docs.lead_paragraph: Australia is in talks to send refugees who try to reach its shores illegally to the Philippines, the immigration minister said Friday.

headline.main: Australia in Talks to Send Refugees to the Philippines
headline.print_headline: Australia in Talks to Send Refugees to the Philippines

docs.snippet: Australia is in talks to send refugees who try to reach its shores illegally to the Philippines, the immigration minister said Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama promised Hispanic leaders on Thursday he'll continue to champion a comprehensive change to the nation's immigration laws and said America's greatness comes from building opportunities, not walls.

headline.main: Obama Touts Immigration Reform in Speech to Hispanic Leaders
headline.print_headline: Obama Touts Immigration Reform in Speech to Hispanic Leaders

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama promised Hispanic leaders on Thursday he'll continue to champion a comprehensive change to the nation's immigration laws and said America's greatness comes from building opportunities, not walls.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Clinton on Thursday called for the breakup of large banks that take excessive risks as part of a sweeping plan to curb what she says are Wall Street abuses.

headline.main: Clinton Courts Left With Promise to Break Up Risky Banks
headline.print_headline: Clinton Courts Left With Promise to Break Up Risky Banks

docs.snippet: U.S. Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Clinton on Thursday called for the breakup of large banks that take excessive risks as part of a sweeping plan to curb what she says are Wall Street abuses.

docs.abstract: Nearly all of us will experience at least one diagnostic error in our lifetimes, a new report says.
docs.snippet: Nearly all of us will experience at least one diagnostic error in our lifetimes, a new report says.

docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese investor Fosun International is looking for more acquisitions in Europe and particularly Germany to give it a range of businesses with strong links to China’s rising consumer classes, Fosun's chief executive said.

headline.main: China's Fosun on the Prowl for European Takeovers
headline.print_headline: China's Fosun on the Prowl for European Takeovers

docs.snippet: Chinese investor Fosun International is looking for more acquisitions in Europe and particularly Germany to give it a range of businesses with strong links to China’s rising consumer classes, Fosun's chief executive said.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. oncologists, aware that patients are paying more of the costs of expensive cancer drugs, are increasingly declining to prescribe medicines that have scant or no effect, even as a last resort.

headline.main: Insight-U.S. Cancer Doctors Drop Pricey Drugs With Little or No Effect
headline.print_headline: Insight-U.S. Cancer Doctors Drop Pricey Drugs With Little or No Effect

docs.snippet: U.S. oncologists, aware that patients are paying more of the costs of expensive cancer drugs, are increasingly declining to prescribe medicines that have scant or no effect, even as a last resort.
